intro: Lagenocarpus guianensis subsp. hypochaetus, commonly known as the Guianan balsa, is a tropical tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its light, porous wood, which is highly valued for its buoyancy and strength. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. This subspecies is adapted to humid, lowland environments and plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
